title: الْمَصْدَرُ الْمُؤَوَّلُ
description: Learn about المصدر المؤول - when أنْ + verb or أنَّ + clause is interpreted as a verbal noun (masdar) and takes the grammatical position of a noun.

notes.title: What is المصدر المؤول?
content: الْمَصْدَر الْمُؤَوَّل (interpreted/derived masdar) is a construction of أَنْ + فِعْل (verb) or أَنَّ + جُمْلَة (clause) that is interpreted as a single noun (masdar) and fills a noun position in the sentence.

It differs from الْمَصْدَر الصَّرِيح (explicit masdar) which is a single word. Example: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَذْهَبَ = أُرِيدُ الذَّهَابَ (I want to go = I want going). The أَنْ أَذْهَبَ is مَصْدَر مُؤَوَّل.
keyPoints: Functions as a noun in the sentence

examples.english: I want to learn = I want learning
It pleases me that you succeeded = Your success pleases me
I knew that knowledge is beneficial
I heard that you are traveling

notes.title: Forms of المصدر المؤول
content: The interpreted masdar is formed with: 1) أَنْ + الْفِعْل الْمُضَارِع الْمَنْصُوب, 2) أَنَّ + اسْمُهَا وَخَبَرُهَا, 3) مَا + الْفِعْل (less common), 4) أَنْ + الْفِعْل الْمَاضِي (rare).
The most common are أَنْ + مُضَارِع and أَنَّ + جُمْلَة. Each can fill any noun position: subject, object, mubtada, khabar, etc.

examples.arabic: أَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ (أَنْ + مضارع = مبتدأ)
examples.english: That you fast is better for you (subject)
I love to read (object)
I knew that you are virtuous (object)
What you did impressed me (subject)

notes.title: Grammatical Positions
content: المصدر المؤول can occupy all noun positions: 1) مُبْتَدَأ: أَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ, 2) خَبَر: الظُّلْمُ أَنْ تَأْخُذَ حَقَّ غَيْرِكَ, 3) فَاعِل: يَسُرُّنِي أَنْ تَنْجَحَ, 4) مَفْعُول بِهِ: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَذْهَبَ.
Also: 5) مَجْرُور: عَجِبْتُ مِنْ أَنَّكَ فَعَلْتَ, 6) مُضَاف إِلَيْهِ: جِئْتُ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَخْرُجَ. The entire أَنْ + فِعْل or أَنَّ + جُمْلَة is treated as one unit.

examples.arabic: أَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ: المصدر المؤول في محل رفع مبتدأ
examples.english: That you fast is better: interpreted masdar as subject

examples.arabic: يَسُرُّنِي أَنْ تَنْجَحَ: المصدر المؤول في محل رفع فاعل
examples.english: Your success pleases me: interpreted masdar as doer

examples.arabic: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَتَعَلَّمَ: المصدر المؤول في محل نصب مفعول به
examples.english: I want to learn: interpreted masdar as object

examples.arabic: جِئْتُ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَخْرُجَ: المصدر المؤول في محل جر بالإضافة
examples.english: I came before you left: interpreted masdar as genitive

notes.title: Converting to Explicit Masdar
content: Every مَصْدَر مُؤَوَّل can be converted to مَصْدَر صَرِيح (explicit masdar). For أَنْ + فِعْل: use the verb's masdar with appropriate additions. For أَنَّ + جُمْلَة: use masdar + possessive.
Example: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَسَافِرَ → أُرِيدُ السَّفَرَ. يَسُرُّنِي أَنَّكَ نَجَحْتَ → يَسُرُّنِي نَجَاحُكَ. The grammatical position remains the same.

examples.english: to travel → traveling
that you fast → your fasting
that you succeeded → your success
that knowledge is beneficial → benefit of knowledge

notes.title: I'rab of المصدر المؤول
content: When analyzing المصدر المؤول, we say: 'الْمَصْدَر الْمُؤَوَّل مِنْ أَنْ وَالْفِعْل فِي مَحَلِّ...' (the interpreted masdar from أَنْ and the verb is in the position of...). The internal i'rab is done separately.
Internal analysis: أَنْ is حَرْف نَصْب and the verb is فِعْل مُضَارِع مَنْصُوب. But as a unit, the whole phrase occupies one grammatical slot.
keyPoints: المصدر المؤول مِن أَنْ والفعل في محل...
Internal: أَنْ حرف نصب، الفعل منصوب
As unit: fills one grammatical slot

examples.arabic: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَذْهَبَ: أَنْ حرف نصب، أَذْهَبَ فعل منصوب
examples.english: أَنْ: subjunctive particle, أَذْهَبَ: subjunctive verb

examples.arabic: والمصدر المؤول في محل نصب مفعول به
examples.english: The interpreted masdar is in accusative position as object

examples.arabic: أَنَّ: حرف توكيد ونصب، والاسم والخبر بعدها
examples.english: أَنَّ: emphatic particle, with its ism and khabar

examples.arabic: المصدر المؤول من أَنَّ ومعموليها في محل...
examples.english: The interpreted masdar from أَنَّ and its complements is in position of...

notes.title: Quranic Examples
content: المصدر المؤول appears frequently in the Quran. وَأَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ (Fasting is better for you - 2:184). أَلَمْ يَعْلَمْ بِأَنَّ اللهَ يَرَى (Does he not know that Allah sees? - 96:14).
Understanding مصدر مؤول is essential for Quranic tafsir and i'rab, as it helps identify the grammatical structure of complex verses.
keyPoints: وَأَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ: masdar as subject

examples.english: And that you fast is better for you (2:184)
Does he not know that Allah sees? (96:14)

examples.arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ اللهَ (الزمر: ١١)
examples.english: Say: I am commanded to worship Allah (39:11)
Allah wants to lighten for you (4:28)

exercises.prompt: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَتَعَلَّمَ - 'أَنْ أَتَعَلَّمَ' هَذَا يُسَمَّى: الْمَصْدَرَ _____
exercises.promptEn: أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَتَعَلَّمَ - 'أَنْ أَتَعَلَّمَ' is called: the _____ masdar

exercises.prompt: وَأَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ - الْمَصْدَرُ الْمُؤَوَّلُ هُنَا فِي مَحَلِّ رَفْعٍ _____
exercises.promptEn: وَأَنْ تَصُومُوا خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ - the interpreted masdar here is in nominative position as _____

exercises.prompt: جِئْتُ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَخْرُجَ - الْمَصْدَرُ الْمُؤَوَّلُ فِي مَحَلِّ جَرٍّ بِـ_____
exercises.promptEn: جِئْتُ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَخْرُجَ - the interpreted masdar is in genitive position by _____

exercises.prompt: الْمَصْدَرُ الْمُؤَوَّلُ يَتَكَوَّنُ مِنْ أَنْ + _____ أَوْ أَنَّ + جُمْلَة
exercises.promptEn: The interpreted masdar is formed from أَنْ + _____ or أَنَّ + clause

exercises.answer: The interpreted masdar (أَنْ + verb or أَنَّ + clause acting as noun)
The explicit masdar (a single word verbal noun)
I want to learn (with interpreted masdar)
